meanings.definition: To make a bid in bridge higher than the previous bid.
meanings.sent1: During the game, she overcalls to show she has a strong hand.
meanings.sent2: He always overcalls when he has a good hand in bridge.
meanings.sent3: The player overcalls with confidence, surprising everyone at the table.
meanings.sent4: Her overcalling strategy in bridge is like a bold move in a game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her overcalls echoes through the room, signaling her intentions clearly.

meanings.sent1: The enthusiastic fan overcalls to get the attention of the singer.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overcall when she wants to be heard in a noisy crowd.
meanings.sent3: The parrot overcalls in an attempt to mimic the sounds of the jungle.
meanings.sent4: His voice overcalls all others in the room, commanding everyone's focus.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's loud overcalls quieted the rowdy classroom, bringing order to chaos.
